items.body_markdown:
I am running CF7 on a webpage. the webpage accepts serial numbers for a product with a textarea box restricted to 1010 characters. Users are requested to input 10 digit serial numbers by hitting enter after each serial number. 

I want to take this entry and validate the entry against a list of serial numbers in myphpadmin database. If a duplicate is found, the textarea box just needs to be highlighted to state that a duplicate serial was found. 

If it is at all possible to highlight the specific serial number that would be great but the previous requirement will suffice for now. 

Any help in providing a complete script is much appreciated.   

If this cannot be done in CF7, then is this possible in MySQL? I have separated out the textarea serial number entries from this same form into separate rows and inserted them into a new database that contains just the list of serial numbers. This new database is populated every time the form is submitted.
items.title: CF7 - Validate list of serial numbers in textarea form field against database
items.body:
I am running CF7 on a webpage. the webpage accepts serial numbers for a product with a textarea box restricted to 1010 characters. Users are requested to input 10 digit serial numbers by hitting enter after each serial number.

I want to take this entry and validate the entry against a list of serial numbers in myphpadmin database. If a duplicate is found, the textarea box just needs to be highlighted to state that a duplicate serial was found.

If it is at all possible to highlight the specific serial number that would be great but the previous requirement will suffice for now.

Any help in providing a complete script is much appreciated.

If this cannot be done in CF7, then is this possible in MySQL? I have separated out the textarea serial number entries from this same form into separate rows and inserted them into a new database that contains just the list of serial numbers. This new database is populated every time the form is submitted.

items.title: Alter the default header/footer when printing to PDF
items.body:
I'm trying to use Google Chrome as a replacement of PhantomJS to render HTML into PDF. So far it's been working well for me. The only issue I have that I have not found any way to translate the following PhantomJS code:

page.paperSize = {
  footer: {
    contents: phantom.callback(function(pageNum, numPages) {
      return "Power by MyWebsite. Created on "+formatDate(new Date())+"<span style='float:right'>" + pageNum + " / " + numPages + "</span>";
    })
  }
}

Format date is the same function as in question How to format a JavaScript date

However I have not found a way to replicate this behavior in Google Chrome in headless.

This is an outline of my chrome remote interface code:

return new Promise(async function (resolve, reject) {
    const url = "<MyURL here>";
    const [tab] = await Cdp.List()
    const client = await Cdp({ host: '127.0.0.1', target: tab });
    await Promise.all([
       Network.enable(),
       Page.enable()
    ]);

    Page.loadEventFired(function () { 
         setTimeout(function () {
             resolve(Page.printToPDF({displayHeaderFooter:true}))); //https://chromedevtools.github.io/devtools-protocol/tot/Page/#method-printToPDF
         }, 3000);
    });
    await Page.navigate({ url }); 
};

I'm getting the PDF just fine but can only get the default Chrome headers and footers. Any way to modify them?

Note: I realise that I can use JavaScript in my page to append elements to the bottom of each page, but I'd prefer to alter the footer that is appended by the browser when exporting/printing as I've found it's much more reliable to get placed correctly and without causing any strange re-flowing of other divs in the page.

                request3.Headers.Add("Authorization", "Bearer " + accessToken)

items.body_markdown:
I'm trying to understand the connect method of react-redux, and the functions it takes as parameters. In particular `mapStateToProps`.

The way I understand it, the return value of `mapStateToProps` will be an object derived from state (as it lives in the store), whose keys will be passed to your target component (the component connect is applied to) as props.

This means that the state as consumed by your target component can have a wildly different structure from the state as it is stored on your store.

Is this OK? Is this expected? Or is this what you pros call an anti-pattern?
items.title: Understanding React-Redux and mapStateToProps
items.body:
I'm trying to understand the connect method of react-redux, and the functions it takes as parameters. In particular mapStateToProps.

The way I understand it, the return value of mapStateToProps will be an object derived from state (as it lives in the store), whose keys will be passed to your target component (the component connect is applied to) as props.

This means that the state as consumed by your target component can have a wildly different structure from the state as it is stored on your store.

Is this OK? Is this expected? Or is this what you pros call an anti-pattern?

items.body_markdown:
I was wondering if it possible to achieve so that error bars are made white with a black border (in a Pandas bar plot)?

I am trying to achieve what is mentioned in the accepted answer in this post (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36173774/border-on-errorbars-in-matplotlib-python?lq=1), however I am wondering if it is possible to implement this for a Pandas plot?

The relevant Pandas plot:
     
    from io import StringIO
    import pandas as pd
    import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
    
    txt = u'''Category    COLUMN1         COLUMN2     COLUMN3    
    A          0.5               3          Cat1   
    B          0.3               5          Cat1 
    C          0.7               4          Cat1
    A          0.4               3          Cat2
    B          0.8               5          Cat2
    C          0.3               4          Cat2
    '''
    
    df = pd.read_table(StringIO(txt), sep="\s+")
    
    order = ['Cat2', 'Cat1']
    suborder = list("BAC")
    
    df2 = pd.pivot_table(df,index='COLUMN3',columns='Category',values='COLUMN2').loc[order]
    df2 = df2[suborder]
    df2.plot(kind='bar', 
             yerr=pd.pivot_table(df,
                                 index='COLUMN3',
                                 columns='Category',values='COLUMN1')
                    .reindex(df2.index)
                    .reindex(df2.columns, axis=1), capsize=4)
items.title: White errorbars with black borders in a Pandas bar plot
items.body:
I was wondering if it possible to achieve so that error bars are made white with a black border (in a Pandas bar plot)?

I am trying to achieve what is mentioned in the accepted answer in this post (Border on errorbars in matplotlib/python), however I am wondering if it is possible to implement this for a Pandas plot?

The relevant Pandas plot:

from io import StringIO
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

txt = u'''Category    COLUMN1         COLUMN2     COLUMN3    
A          0.5               3          Cat1   
B          0.3               5          Cat1 
C          0.7               4          Cat1
A          0.4               3          Cat2
B          0.8               5          Cat2
C          0.3               4          Cat2
'''

df = pd.read_table(StringIO(txt), sep="\s+")

order = ['Cat2', 'Cat1']
suborder = list("BAC")

df2 = pd.pivot_table(df,index='COLUMN3',columns='Category',values='COLUMN2').loc[order]
df2 = df2[suborder]
df2.plot(kind='bar', 
         yerr=pd.pivot_table(df,
                             index='COLUMN3',
                             columns='Category',values='COLUMN1')
                .reindex(df2.index)
                .reindex(df2.columns, axis=1), capsize=4)

items.body_markdown:
I am reading data from a microcontroller via serial, at a baudrate of 921600.  I'm reading a large amount of ASCII csv data, and since it comes in so fast, the buffer get's filled and all the rest of the data gets lost before I can read it.  I know I could manually edit the pyserial source code for serialwin32 to increase the buffer size, but I was wondering if there is another way around it?

I can only estimate the amount of data I will receive, but it is somewhere around 200kB of data.
items.title: Pyserial buffer fills faster than I can read
items.body:
I am reading data from a microcontroller via serial, at a baudrate of 921600. I'm reading a large amount of ASCII csv data, and since it comes in so fast, the buffer get's filled and all the rest of the data gets lost before I can read it. I know I could manually edit the pyserial source code for serialwin32 to increase the buffer size, but I was wondering if there is another way around it?

I can only estimate the amount of data I will receive, but it is somewhere around 200kB of data.

items.title: Android: Two Dependencies, Each One Depends on Same Component, Triggers DexArchiveMergerException
items.body:
I have a situation in which my project consists of two different libraries that apparently has a dependency on the same component:

gradle.build of the client app:

android {
...
}

dependencies {
...
implementation <dependency # 1>
implementation <dependency # 2>
...
}

The error that I am seeing:

org.gradle.api.tasks.TaskExecutionException: Execution failed for task ':app:transformDexArchiveWithExternalLibsDexMergerForDebug'.

The Android issue in question:

Program type already present: <package name>.<Component>

We've recently made gradle changes to one of these dependencies in hopes of eliminating this error:

build.gradle - dependency # 1

android {
...
}

dependencies {
...
api <dependency # 1>
api <dependency # 2>
...
}

But this change apparently has no affect on the outcome.

We have multidex enabled. This property also has no affect on the outcome.

I even went as far as adding this block of code to the gradle file of my client app:

configurations {
    runtime.exclude group: "<package name>", module: "<problem module>"
}

per examples provided here: https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/dependency_types.html

I'm beginning to run low on options.

Is it possible to make a gradle configuration change to one, multiple, or all of the gradle files in order to put a stop to this? If so, what options do I have?

items.title: ESP8266-01 loads from Arduino IDE but doesn't run
items.body:
I had this working fine a few months ago but can't seem figure out what's changed. I have several ESP-01 and I can upload using Arduino IDE with Generic 8266 board profile but I can't get anything to run. Nothing shows on the Serial Monitor. I've tried simple code like:

void setup() {
  // put your setup code here, to run once:
  delay(1000);
  Serial.begin(115200);
  delay(1000);
  Serial.println("Hello, you've entered setup()...");
}

void loop() {
  // put your main code here, to run repeatedly:
  Serial.println("Good day, you're in loop()...");
  delay(2000);
}

I've tried using a jumper to 3.3v on the ENable pin and a 10k resister. I've removed the GPIO0 after programming. Nothing seems to work. I have 4 chips so I know I'm not doing something.

I have 3.3v on VCC (measured), nothing on RST, EN to VCC (tried 10k to VCC), TX - RX, RX - TX, 0 - Gnd for programming, nothing on 2, Gnd - Gnd

items.title: Unity C# – Accessing subclass properties from variable defined as derived class

I'm trying to write an xml parser to take some data in a game and build out objects for me. Right now I want to go through the nodes and build out different config objects based on the node/attributes.

foreach (XmlNode node in actionList) {
  ActionConfig config;
  if (some checks determine action is "Fire") {
    config = new FireActionConfig();
    config.speed = (float)node.Attributes["speed"].Value;
  }
  // do something with config
}

The error I get is "ActionConfig does not contain a definition for speed...". I tried casting config as FireActionConfig even though it's already defined as one.

items.title: Python "with" Keyword in Lambda Functions
items.body:
How is Python's with keyword expressed in a lambda function? Consider the following:

def cat (filename):
    with open(filename, 'r') as f:
        return f.read()

A failed attempt at a lambda implementation:

cat = lambda filename: with open(filename, 'r') as f: return f.read()

items.title: "Error loading documents" on Cloud Firestore when console left open for a while
items.body:
I noticed a quite new phenomenon which is that when I leave the console open for over a couple of minutes I get an "Error loading documents" error on all my collections until I refresh the page. This never happened before regardless of how long I left it open.

The only thing that has changed was that I was experimenting with the rules, but at the end went back to the default setup.

My question is whether this might have repercussions on how my users access their information. Please see below the current rules (commented are the ones that I published for about 10 minutes to test).

service cloud.firestore {
  match /databases/{database}/documents {

//     match /users/{user}/{document=**} {
//       allow read;
//       allow write: if request.auth.uid == user;
//     }

//     match /items/{document=**} {
//       allow read;
//       allow write: if get(/databases/$(database)/documents/users/$(request.auth.uid)).data.admin == true;
//     }

//     match /completedItems/{document=**} {
//       allow read;
//       allow write: if get(/databases/$(database)/documents/users/$(request.auth.uid)).data.admin == true;
//     }

    match /{document=**} {
      allow read, write: if request.auth.uid != null;
    }

  }
}

Thanks!

items.title: Reading multiple files with one thread for each file
items.body:
I'm new to Java and I'm having a really hard time with this. My teacher wants me to create a program that reads N .txt files and puts them into a single new .txt file, indexing them so this unique file will have a list with word/frequency/files it appears in.

Now here's the thing: he wants me to use threads for each new file it reads. How would I do that?

Right now all I managed to do was list the documents from the folder inside the main class:

File files= new File("C:/0_folder/");
    String[] str = files.list();

    for(String strg:str){
        System.out.println(strg);
    }

That's obviously not what I need to do, so where should I begin to finally understand how to use threads in this scenario?

items.title: Displaying image on Datatable
items.body:
Hi guys i'm using server side processing to read the database table and convert the records into Json file, and pass it to the database table to display data.

read database and convert it into json code:

 Route::get('banner/list/banners/json/{id}', function ()
   {
      $banner = DB::table('banner_creatives')->where('Id','=','53')->get();

      $recordsTotal = count($banner);

      $data['draw'] = 1;
      $data['recordsTotal'] = $recordsTotal;
      $data['recordsFiltered'] = $recordsTotal;

      $data['data'] = $banner;

      return Response::json($data);
   });

Json output:

  {"draw":1,"recordsTotal":1,"recordsFiltered":1,"data":[{"id":1,"bId":26,"cId":53,"bName":"32_32_53.jpeg","storageType":"url","width":32,"height":32,"weight":1,"imageURL":"localhost:8000\\\/banner\\\/view\\\/32_32_53.jpeg","clickURL":"","created_at":"2015-01-26 12:32:28","updated_at":"2015-01-26 12:32:28","deleted_at":null}]}

as you can see on this json i have the image Url that i want to display it on the table.

JavaScript code:

   $(document).ready(function() {
    var table = $('#banner').DataTable( {
    "processing": true,
    "serverSide": false,
    "ajax": "banners/json/53",
    "columns": [
        { "data": "id" },
        { "data": "bannerId" },
        { "data": "campaignId" },
        { "data": "bannerName" },
        { "data": "width" },
        { "data": "height" },
        { "data": "imageUrl" }
    });
 });

Datatable code:

 <table id="banner" class="display table table-striped table-bordered table-hover dataTable no-footer" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
                        <thead>
                            <tr>
                                <th>id</th>
                                <th>Banner Id</th>
                                <th>Campaign Id</th>
                                <th>Banner Name</th>
                                <th>Width</th>
                                <th>Height</th>
                                <th>Image/Banner</th>
                            </tr>
                        </thead>
                        <tfoot>
                            <tr>
                                <th>id</th>
                                <th>Banner Id</th>
                                <th>Campaign Id</th>
                                <th>Banner Name</th>
                                <th>Width</th>
                                <th>Height</th>
                                <th>Image/Banner</th>
                            </tr>
                        </tfoot>
                    </table>

On the last column it displaying the image URL but is not what i want, i want to display the usually image on the datatable using the URL, if it possible.

items.title: Laravel Submit button re-routing to Home Page
items.body:
So I used the default Registration Form Laravel.

Made copy of the Registration Form to make a slightly different one.

Basically there is two sign up forms

  1. Starter - original

  2. Bronze - Copy

--My Routing List--

Auth::routes();
Route::get('/register', function(){
  return View::make('auth.register');
});

Route::get('/bronze', function(){
  return View::make('auth.bronze');
});

Route::get('/login', function(){
  return View::make('auth.login');
});

Now every time I submit the bronze sign up form, it redirects me to my home page.

I'm thinking maybe its my Action call in my view. which is identical to the Starter Form

<form class="form-horizontal" role="form" method="POST" action="{{ url('/register') }}">

if I'm correct what I just did is bad practice, but I'm a new-bie at this framework.

items.body_markdown:
With the stock functionality. The pagination loops. If I have 100 objects in the table and I get to page 5 (20 per page) and hit next, the pagination goes back to page 1. Can this be prevented with some parameter changes? Documentation is lacking here.

For an example of the issue see the first grid on the examples page: 
https://www.jqwidgets.com/jquery-widgets-documentation/documentation/jqxgrid/jquery-grid-paging.htm?search=

Just keep hitting next using the bottom right pagination and notice how it loops back to page one after the highest page is hit.
items.title: JQX grid pagination keeps looping instead of ending on highest page value
items.body:
With the stock functionality. The pagination loops. If I have 100 objects in the table and I get to page 5 (20 per page) and hit next, the pagination goes back to page 1. Can this be prevented with some parameter changes? Documentation is lacking here.

For an example of the issue see the first grid on the examples page: https://www.jqwidgets.com/jquery-widgets-documentation/documentation/jqxgrid/jquery-grid-paging.htm?search=

items.body_markdown:
I am trying to attach to process by PID or Name to my application currently published on the store but without any success till now.

I need to attach the process in order to get my production push Id token since no NSLog exist. I need to retrieve that field in order to test the production push after facing issue in delivering production notification.
My Debugger shown LLDB once I clicked on "Attach to process by PID or Name"
I tried searching forums for this matter, but all I found is attaching the process in development mode.

 > Ensure “AppName” is not already running, and YourUser has permission to debug it.

Is there a way to attach apps from store and debug it?

I need to attach the process in order to get my production push Id token since no NSLog exist. I need to retrieve that field in order to test the production push after facing issue in delivering production notification. Ensure “AppName” is not already running, and YourUser has permission to debug it.

Is there a way to attach apps from store and debug it?

items.title: JSON Parsing and Error in C#
items.body:
I am having trouble parsing a JSON from the Alpha Vantage API. The output of the JSON is as follows

{
"Realtime Currency Exchange Rate": {
    "1. From_Currency Code": "BTC",
    "2. From_Currency Name": "Bitcoin",
    "3. To_Currency Code": "CNY",
    "4. To_Currency Name": "Chinese Yuan",
    "5. Exchange Rate": "43211.50782620",
    "6. Last Refreshed": "2018-04-11 17:48:12",
    "7. Time Zone": "UTC"
   }
}

I am parsing it like this

using (var wc = new System.Net.WebClient())
            json = wc.DownloadString(link);
            dynamic stuff = JsonConvert.DeserializeObject(json);
            string test = stuff["Realtime Currency Exchange Rate"]["5. Exchange Rate"];

However when I run the code, I am getting this error

Microsoft.CSharp.RuntimeBinder.RuntimeBinderException: 'Cannot perform runtime binding on a null reference'

Anyone have any idea? If I print the value in a textbox, the value shows up but afterwards it shows that error. I am coding in c#

Thanks

items.body_markdown:
Whenever I deploy jetty application I hit this issue. Looks like some `jar` or class is broken.

 - Colleagues compiling exactly same code, doesn't hit the issue. Even if the deploy to the same computer. (we use `git` and `maven`)
 - Deleting local maven repository `~/.m2` and rebuilding doesn't help.
 - Can run same jetty app locally without any issues.
 - My initial suspect was that some `jar` is broken. Tried `jar tvf $every_jar` and haven't found anything.

Any ideas how can I debug this? Looks really mysterious and I suspect is that some file get corrupted.

items.title: Strange java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException thrown on jetty startup
items.body:
Whenever I deploy jetty application I hit this issue. Looks like some jar or class is broken.

  • Colleagues compiling exactly same code, doesn't hit the issue. Even if the deploy to the same computer. (we use git and maven)
  • Deleting local maven repository ~/.m2 and rebuilding doesn't help.
  • Can run same jetty app locally without any issues.

items.title: SAS issue with Rename variable
items.body:
I have a dataset with 6 character variables including Day5,Day6,Day7,City1,City2,City3. I am trying to rename Day5 which was extracted as i__Day5 after importing txt file into SAS. The variable i__day5 is not getting renamed to day5 and so it does not shows any observation for this variable.

data subset ;
set subset ;
rename i__Day5 = Day5;
run;

Thanks.

items.body_markdown:
I have the following command line:

    mongo --host localhost --port 27017 -u "johnny" -p "secret" --authenticationDatabase "test"

Translated into PyMongo, I wrote this (`db_name` needs to be passed as a param):

    MongoClient().get_database(db_name).authenticate('johnny', 'secret', db_name)

It works, but is there a way to suppress the first `get_database()` call?
items.title: Username/Password authentication against a database requires to pass db name twice
items.body:
I have the following command line:

mongo --host localhost --port 27017 -u "johnny" -p "secret" --authenticationDatabase "test"

Translated into PyMongo, I wrote this (db_name needs to be passed as a param):

MongoClient().get_database(db_name).authenticate('johnny', 'secret', db_name)

It works, but is there a way to suppress the first get_database() call?

items.title: Python groupby(). What does [1:4] mean?
items.body:
I'm new to Python. Can anybody break down the process here per line? What does the [1:4] do? Thank you.

def answer_six(): 
    copy_df = census_df.copy()
    copy_df = copy_df.groupby(['STNAME']) 
    states_pop = pd.DataFrame(columns=['pop'])
    for i, c in copy_df: 
        states_pop.loc[i] = [c.sort_values(by='CENSUS2010POP', ascending=False)[1:4]['CENSUS2010POP'].sum()]
        top3 = states_pop.nlargest(3,'pop') 
    return states_pop answer_six()

items.title: Converting custom Lucene index configuration to Solr in Sitecore
items.body:
I have a custom Lucene file which i need to convert into Solr. The config file looks something like the one mentioned below. How do we convert into Solr? 

 <configuration xmlns:patch="http://www.sitecore.net/xmlconfig/">
  <sitecore>
    <contentSearch>
      <indexConfigurations>

        <customMasterSearchTermConfig type="Sitecore.ContentSearch.LuceneProvider.LuceneIndexConfiguration, Sitecore.ContentSearch.LuceneProvider">
          <indexAllFields>false</indexAllFields>
          <initializeOnAdd>true</initializeOnAdd>
          <analyzer ref="contentSearch/indexConfigurations/defaultLuceneIndexConfiguration/analyzer" />
          <fieldMap type="Sitecore.ContentSearch.FieldMap, Sitecore.ContentSearch">
            <fieldNames hint="raw:AddFieldByFieldName">
              <field fieldName="_uniqueid" storageType="YES" indexType="TOKENIZED"    vectorType="NO" boost="1f" type="System.String" settingType="Sitecore.ContentSearch.LuceneProvider.LuceneSearchFieldConfiguration, Sitecore.ContentSearch.LuceneProvider">
                <analyzer type="Sitecore.ContentSearch.LuceneProvider.Analyzers.LowerCaseKeywordAnalyzer, Sitecore.ContentSearch.LuceneProvider" />
              </field>
              <!--<field fieldName="Subheading" storageType="Yes" indexType="TOKENIZED" vectorType="No" boost="if" type="System.String" settingType=""></field>-->
              <field fieldName="Value" storageType="YES" indexType="TOKENIZED" vectorType="NO" boost="1f" type="System.String" settingType="Sitecore.ContentSearch.LuceneProvider.LuceneSearchFieldConfiguration, Sitecore.ContentSearch.LuceneProvider" />
              <!--<analyzer type="Sitecore.ContentSearch.LuceneProvider.Analyzers.LowerCaseKeywordAnalyzer, Sitecore.ContentSearch.LuceneProvider" />-->
              <!--</field>-->
            </fieldNames>
          </fieldMap>
          <include hint="list:IncludeField">
            <fieldId>{B8978923-AFD2-44F4-8010-F8A0EC79F61D}</fieldId>
          </include>
          <fieldReaders ref="contentSearch/indexConfigurations/defaultLuceneIndexConfiguration/fieldReaders" />
          <indexFieldStorageValueFormatter ref="contentSearch/indexConfigurations/defaultLuceneIndexConfiguration/indexFieldStorageValueFormatter" />
          <indexDocumentPropertyMapper ref="contentSearch/indexConfigurations/defaultLuceneIndexConfiguration/indexDocumentPropertyMapper" />
        </customMasterSearchTermConfig>
      </indexConfigurations>
    </contentSearch>
  </sitecore>
</configuration>

items.title: Custom ValidationAttribute doesn't work, ignore the error line
items.body:
I'm tryng to create a custom ValidationAttribute: In the class Person there is an atributte where if you enter a number that is not divisible by 2, an error should appear

[Divide(2, ErrorMessage = "The number you have chosen can not be divided by 2")]
public int numeroDivisibleEntre2 { get; set; }

Then i have the class DivideAttribute:

public class DivideAttribute: ValidationAttribute
{
    private int _divisor;

    public DivideAttribute(int value)
        : base("El campo {0} no es valido")
    {
        _divisor = value;
    }

    protected override ValidationResult IsValid(object value, ValidationContext validationContext)
    {
        if (value != null)
        {

            if ((int)value % _divisor != 0)
            {

                var mensajeError = FormatErrorMessage(validationContext.DisplayName);
                return new ValidationResult(mensajeError);
            }
        }
        return ValidationResult.Success;

    }

}

Apparently the class DivideAttribute is being recognized by the model (Person Class), but the validation is not being recognized. Anybody can help me?

items.body_markdown:
I'm looking for something that can help me with identify the category of a site.
For example: https://www.cyren.com/security-center/url-category-check
Something like the cyren but wrote in python.
I think about scrap the site and if I see 20 words like "sports" I can say that it's a sports site but it doesn't what I'm looking for.

items.title: React Gastby not rendering correctly
items.body:
I developed a react static website using GatsbyJS. My project is done (gatsby develop) is fine, but when I try to build my project (gatsby build) it's not rendering correctly.

I can't find the error. I imported react-reveal plug in ...

You can see the that here : www.polwisurfcenter.com

Could anyone help me !

import React from 'react'
import Link from 'gatsby-link'
import YouTube from 'react-youtube'
import {Gmaps, Marker, InfoWindow, Circle} from 'react-gmaps';
import '../style/home.scss'
import Navbar from '../components/navbar'
import Footer from '../components/footer'
import Wave from '../images/wave.svg'
import Surfer from '../images/surfer.svg'
import Board from '../images/board.svg'
import Van from '../images/van.png'
import Van2 from '../images/van2.png'
import Miniature1 from '../images/miniature1.png'
import Miniature2 from '../images/miniature2.png'
import Miniature3 from '../images/miniature3.png'
import Miniature4 from '../images/miniature4.png'
import UnderlineOrange from '../images/underline_orange.svg'
import UnderlineGreen from '../images/underline_green.svg'
import Layout1 from '../images/layout1.png'
import Layout2 from '../images/layout2.png'
import Layout3 from '../images/layout3.png'
import Layout4 from '../images/layout4.png'
import Max from '../images/max.png'
import Logo from '../images/white-orange.png'
import ImageBackground from '../images/image-background.png'

import Fade from 'react-reveal/Fade'; // Importing Zoom effect
import Slide from 'react-reveal/Slide';
import Flip from 'react-reveal/Flip';

class Home extends React.Component {
  render() {
    const videoOptions = {
      playerVars: { // https://developers.google.com/youtube/player_parameters
        autoplay: 1,
        controls: 0,
        loop: 1,
        showinfo: 1,
        modestbranding: 1,
        rel: 0
      }
    };
    const videoOptions2 = {
      playerVars: { // https://developers.google.com/youtube/player_parameters
        autoplay: 0,
        controls: 1,
        loop: 0,
        showinfo: 0,
        modestbranding: 1,
        rel: 1
      }
    };
    const coords = {
      lat: 16.422740,
      lng: -61.533347
    };

    const params = {
      v: '3.exp',
      key: 'AIzaSyA8v4LfZIsueHQb8hxZoNq3mj1c5pbiC30'
    };
    const imageUrlLayout2 = require(`../images/layout2.png`)
    const imageUrlMiniature1 = require(`../images/miniature1.png`)
    const imageUrlMiniature2 = require(`../images/miniature2.png`)
    const imageUrlMiniature3 = require(`../images/miniature3.png`)
    const imageUrlMiniature4 = require(`../images/miniature4.png`)

    return (<div className="page-landing">
      <Navbar/>
      <div className="video-background">
        <div className="video-foreground">
          <YouTube videoId="f99bCywk5DA" opts={videoOptions} className="video-iframe" onReady={this._onReady} onEnd={this._onEnd}/>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div className="image-background">
        <img className="background" src={ImageBackground} alt="background"></img>
      </div>
      <a className="phone-call" href="tel:0033695335509">
        <div className="icon-phone phone"></div>
      </a>
      <div className="first-screen-container">
        <Fade duration={3000} delay={500}>
          <div className="title-container">
            <div className="title">APPRENDS A SURFER EN GUADELOUPE</div>
          </div>
        </Fade>
        <temp></temp>
        <Fade duration={3000} delay={1000}>
          <button className="button-book">
            <a href="tel:0033695335509">
            <div className="icon-more more"></div>
            <div className="book">RESERVER</div>
            <img className="wave" src={Wave} alt="wave"></img>
            </a>
          </button>
        </Fade>
        <img className="van" src={Van} alt="van"></img>
      </div>
      <div className="second-screen-container">
        <title>
          <div>UN CADRE EXCEPTIONNEL</div>
          <Fade duration={1500} delay={500}>
            <img className="underline" src={UnderlineOrange} alt="underline"></img>
          </Fade>
        </title>
        <div className="core-container">
          <div className="side-container">
            <div className="row">
              <Fade duration={1500} delay={500} left="left">
                <div className="miniature-container" style={{
                    backgroundImage: `url(${imageUrlMiniature1})`
                  }}>
                  <div className="miniature-description">UNE PLAGE DE REVE</div>
                </div>
              </Fade>
              <Fade duration={1500} delay={500} right="right">
                <div className="miniature-container" style={{
                    backgroundImage: `url(${imageUrlMiniature2})`
                  }}>
                  <div className="miniature-description">UNE EAU A 28°</div>
                </div>
              </Fade>
            </div>

            <div className="row">
              <Fade duration={1500} delay={500} left="left">
                <div className="miniature-container" style={{
                    backgroundImage: `url(${imageUrlMiniature3})`
                  }}>
                  <div className="miniature-description">DES VAGUES PARFAITES</div>
                </div>
              </Fade>
              <Fade duration={1500} delay={500} right="right">
                <div className="miniature-container" style={{
                    backgroundImage: `url(${imageUrlMiniature4})`
                  }}>
                  <div className="miniature-description">FACILE D'ACCES ET PARKING GRATUIT</div>
                </div>
              </Fade>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div className="side-container">
            <Gmaps className="gmaps" lat={coords.lat} lng={coords.lng} zoom={10} loadingMessage={'Be happy'} params={params} onMapCreated={this.onMapCreated}>
              <Marker lat={coords.lat} lng={coords.lng} draggable={true} onDragEnd={this.onDragEnd}/>
              <Circle lat={coords.lat} lng={coords.lng} radius={500} onClick={this.onClick}/>
            </Gmaps>
            <div className="maps-description">PORT-LOUIS, GUADELOUPE</div>
          </div>
          <img className="layout1" src={Layout1} alt="layout"></img>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div className="third-screen-container">
        <title className="white">
          <div>ECOLE DE SURF MAX MARIANNE</div>
          <Fade duration={1500} delay={500}>
            <img className="underline" src={UnderlineGreen} alt="underline"></img>
          </Fade>
        </title>

        <div className="core-container">
          <Fade duration={3000} delay={500}>
            <img className="max" src={Max} alt="max"></img>
          </Fade>
          <Fade duration={3000} delay={1000}>
            <div className="layout2-container" style={{
                backgroundImage: `url(${imageUrlLayout2})`
              }}>
              <subtitle>
                <div>MAX MARIANNE</div>
                <img className="underline" src={UnderlineGreen} alt="underline"></img>
              </subtitle>
              <div className="resume-container">
                <div className="resume-row">ANCIEN BODYBOARDER PRO</div>
                <div className="resume-row">25 ANS D'EXPERIENCE</div>
                <div className="resume-row">DIPLOME D'ETAT</div>
                <div className="resume-row">DEBOUT AU 1ER COURS GARANTI</div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </Fade>
        </div>
        <img className="van2" src={Van2} alt="van"></img>
      </div>

      <div className="fourth-screen-container">
        <title>
          <div>PRESTATIONS</div>
          <Fade duration={1500} delay={500}>
            <img className="underline" src={UnderlineOrange} alt="underline"></img>
          </Fade>
        </title>

        <div className="core">
          <Fade duration={3000} delay={500}>
          <div className="service-container">
            <div className="service-header">
              <div>COURS</div>
            </div>

            <div className="service-title">SURF & BODYBOARD</div>
            <div className="service-subtitle">COURS PARTICULIERS</div>
            <div className="service-subtitle">COURS COLLECTIFS</div>
            <div className="service-title inline">PADDLE</div>
            <div className="service-subtitle">INITIATION</div>
            <div className="service-subtitle">FAMILLE</div>
            <div className="service-subtitle">RANDONEE</div>
            <temp></temp>
            <button className="button-book">
              <a href="tel:0033695335509">
              <div>RESERVER</div>
              <img className="button-icon" src={Surfer} alt="surfer"></img>
              </a>
            </button>
          </div>
        </Fade>
        <Fade duration={3000} delay={1000}>
          <div className="service-container orange">
            <div className="service-header">
              <div>LOCATION</div>
            </div>

            <div className="service-title first">STAND UP PADDLE</div>
            <div className="service-title">SURF BIC</div>
            <div className="service-title">LONGBOARD</div>
            <div className="service-title">SURF RESINE</div>
            <div className="service-title">BODYBOARD</div>
            <div className="service-title">PALMES</div>
            <temp></temp>
            <button className="button-book">
              <a href="tel:0033695335509">
              <div>RESERVER</div>
              <img className="button-icon" src={Board} alt="board"></img>
              </a>
            </button>
          </div>
        </Fade>
        </div>
        <img className="layout3" src={Layout3} alt="layout"></img>
      </div>
      <div className="galery-screen-container">
        <title className="white">
          <div>GALERIE</div>
          <Fade duration={1500} delay={500}>
            <img className="underline" src={UnderlineGreen} alt="underline"></img>
          </Fade>
        </title>
        <div className="core">
          <YouTube className="video-galery" videoId="f99bCywk5DA" opts={videoOptions2} onReady={this.onReady} onEnd={this.onEnd}/>
          <img className="logo-image" src={Logo} alt="logo"></img>
        </div>
      </div>
      <Footer/>
    </div>);
  }

  _onReady(event) {
    // access to player in all event handlers via event.target
    event.target.playVideo();
    event.target.mute();
  }
  onReady(event) {
    // access to player in all event handlers via event.target
  }
  onEnd(event) {
    event.target.playVideo();
  }
  _onEnd(event) {
    event.target.playVideo();
  }
  onMapCreated(map) {
    map.setOptions({disableDefaultUI: true});
  }

  onDragEnd(e) {
    console.log('onDragEnd', e);
  }

  onCloseClick() {
    console.log('onCloseClick');
  }

  onClick(e) {
    console.log('onClick', e);
  }
}

export default Home
